pkgmetadata.longdescription: beziers.py----------Beziers provides a variety of classes for constructing, manipulating anddrawing Bezier curves and paths. Principally designed for font designsoftware, it allows you to join, split, offset, and perform many otheroperations on paths.Here is an example session:: from beziers.point import Point from beziers.path import BezierPath from beziers.cubicbezier import CubicBezier b1 = CubicBezier( Point(412.0,500.0), Point(308.0,665.0), Point(163.0,589.0), Point(163.0,504.0) ) b2 = CubicBezier( Point(163.0,504.0), Point(163.0,424.0), Point(364.0,321.0), Point(366.0,216.0) ) b3 = CubicBezier( Point(366.0,216.0), Point(368.0,94.0), Point(260.0,54.0), Point(124.0,54.0) ) path = BezierPath.fromSegments([b1,b2,b3]) path.closed = False path.addExtremes() path.balance() path.translate(Point(-100.0,-100.0)) import matplotlib.pyplot as plt fig, ax = plt.subplots() path.addExtremes() path.plot(ax) plt.show()Full documentation is available at https://simoncozens.github.io/beziers.py/index.html
